header.description: Required only for Sandbox API requests; to get one, please sign up to the [Developer Portal](https://developers.qonto.com/).
(Required) Learn more in [Idempotent Requests](/get-started/general/idempotent-requests).
(Optional) Use only if you authenticate yourself with your API key

request.description:
OAuth scope: `attachment.write`

Uploads a single attachment (JPEG, PNG or PDF).

This operation will enable you to link the uploaded attachement to an external transfer (through [POST /v2/external_transfers](/api-reference/business-api/endpoints/external-transfers/create-an-external-transfer-for-a-trusted-beneficiary) or [POST /v2/external_transfers/checkout](/api-reference/business-api/endpoints/external-transfers/create-external-transfers-with-beneficiaries-data)).

In the Qonto app, attachments are files uploaded onto transactions by users. Attachments typically correspond to the *invoice* or *receipt*, and are used to justify the transactions from a bookkeeping standpoint.

request.description:
OAuth scope: `organization.read`

Retrieves the attachment identified by the `id` path parameter.

In the Qonto app, attachments are files uploaded onto transactions by users. Attachments typically correspond to the *invoice* or *receipt*, and are used to justify the transactions from a bookkeeping standpoint.

You can retrieve the IDs of those attachments inside each `transaction` object, by calling [GET /v2/transactions](/reference/openapi_v2.yml/paths/~1v2~1transactions/get).

Probative attachment is another version of attachment, compliant with [PAdES](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/PAdES) standard.

<Warning>
  For security reasons, the `url` you retrieve for each attachment is **only valid for 30 minutes**. If you need to download the file after more than 30 minutes, you will need to perform another authenticated call in order to generate a new download URL.
</Warning>

<Note>
  If you download the file using `curl`, replace the `\\u0026` references by `&` in the `url` string.
</Note>

response.name: Returns the attachment identified by the `id` path parameter.

item.name: Upload an attachment to a transaction

header.description: Required only for Sandbox API requests; to get one, please sign up to the [Developer Portal](https://developers.qonto.com/).
(Required) Learn more in [Idempotent Requests](/get-started/general/idempotent-requests).
(Optional) Use only if you authenticate yourself with your API key

request.description:
OAuth scope: `attachment.write`

Uploads a single attachment (JPEG, PNG or PDF) to the transaction identified by the `id` path parameter.

In the Qonto app, attachments are files uploaded onto transactions by users. Attachments typically correspond to the *invoice* or *receipt*, and are used to justify the transactions from a bookkeeping standpoint.

<Info>
  The uploaded file will be processed in the background. This means that the created attachment will not be visible immediately.
</Info>

response.name: Accepts the file and returns a success status code.

item.name: Remove an attachment from a transaction

header.description: Required only for Sandbox API requests; to get one, please sign up to the [Developer Portal](https://developers.qonto.com/).
(Optional) Use only if you authenticate yourself with your API key

request.description:
OAuth scope: `attachment.write`



Removes the attachment identified by the `attachment_id` path parameter from the transaction identified by the `transaction_id` path parameter.



In the Qonto app, attachments are files uploaded onto transactions by users. Attachments typically correspond to the *invoice* or *receipt*, and are used to justify the transactions from a bookkeeping standpoint.

request.description:
OAuth scope: `organization.read`

Retrieves all the attachments for the transaction identified by the `id` path parameter.

In the Qonto app, attachments are files uploaded onto transactions by users. Attachments typically correspond to the *invoice* or *receipt*, and are used to justify the transactions from a bookkeeping standpoint.

You can retrieve the IDs of those attachments inside each `transaction` object, by calling [GET /v2/transactions](/reference/openapi_v2.yml/paths/~1v2~1transactions/get).

Probative attachment is another version of attachment, compliant with [PAdES](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/PAdES) standard.

<Warning>
  For security reasons, the `url` you retrieve for each attachment is **only valid for 30 minutes**. If you need to download the file after more than 30 minutes, you will need to perform another authenticated call in order to generate a new download URL.
</Warning>

<Note>
  If you download the file using `curl`, replace the `\\u0026` references by `&` in the `url` string.
</Note>

response.name: Returns the list of attachments for the transaction identified by the `id` path parameter.
